definition: a bunch of nonsense
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
surname Hu
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
beard/mustache/whiskers
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
words/speech/to say/to talk

sentences.english: People who know him are sure that it's absolute piffle.
sentences.chinese: 了解他的人都知道，那纯粹是一派胡言。

sentences.english: This is sheer nonsense. / This is a complete lie.
More than purely seems to me from the nonsense of a newspaper to see if the.
sentences.chinese: 以上纯属我从某报看来的一派胡言，看看就算了。

sentences.english: Don't believe a word he is saying;It's all a pack of lies.
sentences.chinese: 他说的话一点也别信，那全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: It is nonsense that they said it was the wrong attack.
sentences.chinese: 他们说他们弄错了攻击对象，这简直是一派胡言。

sentences.english: The characters in this story are all fictitious.
sentences.chinese: 那些故事都是假的，全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: Employees are likely to laugh their tails off at any boss who cites this drivel as inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 老板要把这一派胡言奉为灵感，雇员可能会笑掉大牙。

sentences.english: Sugar said it was a "load of hog -wash" that he was not interested in football.
sentences.chinese: 休格声称，说他对足球不感兴趣是“一派胡言”。

sentences.english: It's all full of psychoanalytic mumbo- jumbo .
sentences.chinese: 这里面全是精神分析的一派胡言。

sentences.english: All this scuttle butt was laughed off as nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 这些小道消息被当作一派胡言而一笑置之。

sentences.english: The government report about the murder was nothing but hogwash.
sentences.chinese: 政府对那件谋杀案的报告只是一派胡言。

sentences.english: Studies show, however, that the notion of anger catharsis is poppycock.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明愤怒宣泄论是一派胡言。

sentences.english: This is, in a word, hogwash.
These hearsay are treated as nonsense and push it away with a smile.
sentences.chinese: 这些小道消息被当作一派胡言而一笑置之。

sentences.english: That story about a trip to the moon is fanciful.
sentences.chinese: 那些故事都是假的，全是一派胡言。

definition: to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to talk rubbish
to spit blood (idiom); venomous slander/malicious attacks
to make false accusations against sb (idiom)
how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
to talk nonsense/drivel
to chatter/nonsense/blather
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
If you want to condemn sb, don't worry about the pretext (idiom, from Zuozhuan 左傳|左传); one can always trump up a charge against sb/Give a dog a bad name, then hang him.
pinyin: yu4 jia1 zhi1 zui4 , he2 huan4 wu2 ci2

definition: to mislead the public with rumors (idiom)/to delude the people with lies
to slander/to smear/to tarnish
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to slander/to smear/to vilify
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to boast shamelessly/to talk big
complete nonsense (idiom)
